subject: RE: Decode of LCT Field in smbpasswd file
body:
It's just the number of seconds as you said, but in hex.

46041f7f = 1174675327 decimal = Fri 2007 Mar 23 18:42:07

> -----Original Message-----
> From: samba-technical-bounces+samba-987=augharue.com@lists.samba.org
> [mailto:samba-technical-bounces+samba-987=augharue.com@lists.s
> amba.org]O
> n Behalf Of Rhodes, Lonnie IT7
> Sent: 18 April 2007 17:12
> To: samba-technical@lists.samba.org
> Subject: Decode of LCT Field in smbpasswd file
> 
> 
> I am trying to find a way to decode the numeric encoding of the UNIX
> time in seconds since 1 Jan 1970 that a samba user last changed their
> password.  The field is similar to the following
> 
> LCT-46041F7F
> 
> Lonnie Rhodes
> Siemens IT Solutions and Services, Inc.
>
